summary: Email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding a discovery production in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The email chain discusses the delivery of hard drives containing discovery materials, corrections to Bates numbers, and arrangements for delivering materials to the defendant at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell corresponding with prosecutors about discovery production details and asking about missing Bates numbers.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on discovery production correspondence.

persons.name: Chris
persons.context: Person under whose name a hard drive is being left for pickup at the prosecutor's office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in case 20 Cr. 330, referenced as the recipient of a hard drive sent to the MDC.

connections.description: Co-defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, both copied on discovery correspondence.
Defense attorney corresponding about discovery materials being sent to her client at the MDC.
Defense attorney copied on correspondence regarding discovery for their client.

events.title: Discovery Production Delivery
events.description: Prosecutors notify defense counsel of an additional discovery production ready for delivery via hard drive and USAfx, including arrangements for delivery to the defendant at MDC.

keyFacts: Discovery materials in US v. Maxwell were being produced on hard drives, with one sent to defense counsel in Colorado and another to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).
A Bates numbering error was corrected in the cover letter, changing SDNY_GM_02774195 to SDNY_GM_02774105.
Some materials (SDNY_GM_02774100-SDNY_GM_02774104) could not be uploaded to USAfx due to size limitations and were included on the hard drive.
The correspondence indicates ongoing pre-trial discovery exchanges between prosecution and defense in late 2021.
